1.title: THE U.S. CITY RAINS SUPREME
clues: "The city so nice they named it twice:, it gets nearly 50" of rain a year... good luck getting a cab!
Averaging 47.8" of rain yearly might be why this city built the first completely domed baseball stadium in the 1960s
It's a wonder that more Kentucky Derbys aren't muddy, as this home city of the race gets 44.5" of rain annually
Elvis got rained on when he moved to this city in 1948; it gets 54.7" a year
Flowers get plenty of chances to bloom in this Pacific Northwest "City of Roses" with 37" of rain a year

2.title: THE 1970s

NYC's "Survivor Tree" was planted on the plaza of this landmark in the '70s; just an 8' stump in 2001, by 2010 it was 30'
Israel's first fighter plane, the Nesher ("Vulture"), took wing & had many kills in this holiday-named 1973 war

6-letter adjective meaning dormant or not yet developed

11.title: ASIAN RELIGION
clues: (Kelly of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from The Royal Palace in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.) Like almost all religious or other important structures in Cambodia, the Throne Hall faces this direction; so it's best photographed in the morning

(Jimmy of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from Vietnam.) To the Hindus, this symbolcan be used to mark openings,While Buddhists use iton representationsOf Buddha's footprints.Its association as a symbolof prosperity and good fortunehave been forever marredby the Nazis
DAILY DOUBLE

(Kelly of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from Banteay Srei Temple in Cambodia.) In a lopsidedand unusual arrangement,Banteay Srei'snorthern sanctuarywas dedicated to Vishnu,while the centraland southern sanctuarieswere dedicatedto this Hindu deity --the destroyer

(Kelly of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from Angkor Wat in Cambodia.) Depicting elaborate scenes from both mythology and history, the many exquisite bas reliefs at Angkor Wat include many representations from this Hindu epic of the Bharata Dynasty

(Jimmy of the Clue Crew delivers the clue from the Bayon Temple in Cambodia.) The faces carvedon the towersthat crown Angkor Thom'sBayon templemay represent Lokesvara,one of these enlightened beingswho choose to stay on earth
